title: Exponential Form
question_text: Which of the following characteristics would indicate that a function has a roughly exponential form?

choices.text: The sum of the residuals is zero.
The residual plot shows a haphazardly scattered pattern.
There exists a common multiple between consecutive terms generated by the function.
The R-squared value is near zero.
A common addend exists to get from one consecutive term to the next.

solution:
An exponential function has a roughly common multiple to get from one term to the next, while a linear function has a roughly common addend to get from one term to the next.

Thus, the correct answer is Choice 'C'.
